Robert Belford

Professor, Chemical Education and Green Chemistry

Dr. Robert E. Belford, associate professor of chemistry at UALR, has received a $200,000 National Science Foundation grant to develop an intercollegiate course in cheminformatics – the modeling of chemical and related biological information on computers

Dr. Belford joined the UALR faculty in 2002 from the University of West Virginia where he was a visiting assistant professor of chemistry. He earned his Ph.D. in chemistry from Arizona State University.

Areas of Expertise

  • Chemistry education and development of education material and tools
  • Cheminformatics
  • Internet of Things
